alert.note: Alert for Esmeralda and Central Nye County; Lincoln County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 19 at 10:51AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .A substantial moisture surge driven by Hurricane Hilary will result in several days with bands of moderate to heavy rainfall over the weekend into early next week. Impacts will become more significant with each passing day as soils become saturated, resulting in increased runoff. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible as a result of increased moisture from Hurricane Hilary. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nevada, including the following areas, Esmeralda and Central Nye County and Lincoln County. * WHEN...From this evening through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Outdoor recreation will be very dangerous this weekend and is strongly ill-advised, particularly in the southwestern Great Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Esmeralda and Central Nye County; Lincoln County
